pullRequest.title: HBASE-25242 Add Increment/Append support to RowMutations

nodes.bodyText: Let's also test for Append and keep the last else branch throwing DoNotRetryIOException?
Why this change?
This is an optimization?
At least for JDK8, stream is slow so let's avoid stream on critical read/write path as much as possible for now.
Why change to AssertionError?
Why remove atomic?

In HBASE-24996 and HBASE-24210, I gave up treating CheckAndMutate as Mutation where we can perform CheckAndMutate with other mutations atomically. Given that, I thought it would be better to make CheckAndMutate implement Row because CheckAndMutate had a lot of unsupported methods. What do you think?
After this change, only Put/Delete/Increment/Append inherit Mutation. Do we still need to test for Append and keep the last else branch throwing DoNotRetryIOException?

This change is that if Increment/Append.isReturnResults() is true, we will return an empty result in case of the retry situation. Originally, it looks like in case of the retry situation, we returned actual result whatever Increment/Append.isReturnResults() is.
Sure, I will change it not to use stream. Thanks.

MutationType can be set to only Put/Delete/Increment/Append. And this switch statement has all the cases (Put/Delete/Increment/Append) after this change, so it is impossible to go the default case. That's why I change it to AssertionError, which means if we hit this AssertionError, it's something a bug. Do you think we should still use DoNotRetryIOException?
This is because I added if statement when atomic is true the above. So atomic is always false here.

afterCommit.message: HBASE-25242 Add Increment/Append support to RowMutations

nodes.bodyText: nits: could remove the empty throws so we could fix on checkstyle warning.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -459,9 +459,10 @@ default CheckAndMutateResult checkAndMutate(CheckAndMutate checkAndMutate) throw
    * {@link Put} and {@link Delete} are supported.
    *
    * @param rm object that specifies the set of mutations to perform atomically
+   * @return results of Increment/Append operations
    * @throws IOException

nodes.bodyText: Mind explaing a bit about this change here? Seems the logic is changed?
Good. It is usually dangerous to use byte[] as the key of a HashMap...
OK, just saw that there is a return above.
Better to use ArrayList instead of LinkedList. ArrayList is faster than LinkedList for most cases. I can not recall the exact number but at least for thousands elements ArrayList is still faster.
We haven't released the CheckAndMutate class yet. It's introduced in 2.4.0. We need to commit this change before releasing 2.4.0.
Sure. I will do that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -459,9 +459,10 @@ default CheckAndMutateResult checkAndMutate(CheckAndMutate checkAndMutate) throw
    * {@link Put} and {@link Delete} are supported.
    *
    * @param rm object that specifies the set of mutations to perform atomically
+   * @return results of Increment/Append operations
    * @throws IOException

nodes.bodyText: Sure. I will add testing for Append and keep the last else branch throwing DoNotRetryIOException.
Sure. I will revert this change.

The reason why I use LinkedList here is that I need to add a element at the beginning of the list as follows:
https://github.com/apache/hbase/pull/2630/files#diff-e4052cd5a1f1c93375e3fbc931dc4df220deebc78c0d53fd2435b47fd04cd807R1019-R1020
https://github.com/apache/hbase/pull/2630/files#diff-e4052cd5a1f1c93375e3fbc931dc4df220deebc78c0d53fd2435b47fd04cd807R1031
Still ArrayList is faster in that case?

The case where actions.hasCondition() is false and actionResult.hasProcessed() is true is the case for a result of mutateRow(). After this change, mutateRow() can return results of Increment/Append operations. That's why we need to add this logic here.

nodes.bodyText: I think here we could just call builder.addResultOrException directly to add the first ResultOrException? And then call addAllResultOrException to add the remaining ResultOrExceptions in the list, so we do not need to add a new element in front?

Mind explaining a bit about the logic here?  I think batchMutate is for multiple operations? Why here we could merge the cells from different Results? We can make sure they are always for the same row?
